definitions.definition: an official agreement intended to resolve a dispute or conflict.
examples: unions succeeded in reaching a pay settlement

definitions.definition: a formal arrangement made between the parties to a lawsuit in order to resolve it, especially out of court.
examples: the owner reached an out-of-court settlement with the plaintiffs

definitions.definition: a place, typically one that has hitherto been uninhabited, where people establish a community.
the process of settling in a new community.
synonyms: populating; historicalplantation "the settlement of the area"

definitions.definition: the action of allowing or helping people to do this.
examples: he was involved in the sale and settlement of Crown land

definitions.definition: an arrangement whereby property passes to a succession of people as dictated by the settlor.
the action or process of settling an account.
examples: payment, discharge, liquidation, clearance the settlement of their debts

definitions.definition: subsidence of the ground or a structure built on it.
examples: a boundary wall, which has cracked due to settlement, is to be replaced
